meaningMnemonic:
Here you have <kanji>other</kanji> and <kanji>person</kanji> joined together by the particle の, which shows that "other" is describing "person". So this means <vocabulary>someone else</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>other people</vocabulary>.

This is more general than 他人, which you already learned. 他の人 can be anyone that's not the speaker, or not the person being talked about. 他人, on the other hand, has an added implication that the person is someone unknown or unrelated.
readingMnemonic: This uses the kanji's kun'yomi readings, which you've already learned. As long as you remember those, you should be good to go!
